metadata.synopsis: The InParty for Lae'zel while in END_Main.Morphic Pool (Arrival)Astral Plane (Just after Netherbrain Confrontation)Tadpole Choice (with Emperor in Astral Plane while making the choice to transform into a mind flayer)High Hall Interior (after Astral Plane, views of Nautiloids, Dragons, and a city in ruin)

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: Make your choice. Endure the consequences.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Such blazing wonder, to stand together and behold the sky swarming with red dragons. Listen close, and you can almost hear them roaring Queen Vlaakith's blessed name.

13.speaker: Lae'zel
13.text: Such blazing wonder - the sky swarming with red dragons. They may roar Vlaakith's name, but I can't deny their beauty.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: Such blazing wonder, to behold the sky swarming with red dragons. Listen close, and you can almost hear them roaring Queen Vlaakith's blessed name.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: The Netherbrain believes it will rise victorious. But it could never predict the extent of our might and the strength of our bond.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: But first, we must attend to the captive prince.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: Let there be no doubt. We will take the hammer, and we will free Orpheus.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: The Prince of the Comet will soar, and the age of Vlaakith will be ended!

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Let's hurry and get it done. The prince has suffered for too long.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: He will suffer no longer. The True Heir Orpheus will destroy the lich queen and show my people true ascension.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I'd like to speak to the Emperor before making any decisions.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: The Emperor deserves no more than a blade in its belly. But go ahead, waste your words on the ghaik.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: I will be watching closely for what you do next.

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: We've returned to the Prism - but with no means to free Orpheus.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: Are my people doomed to eternally suffer at the hands of the lich queen Vlaakith?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Let's talk to the Emperor. We might still find a way to free Orpheus.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: The Emperor deserves no more than a blade in its belly. But you are right, we must explore every option -

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: Even if it means parlaying with the ghaik.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: No, no - I won't abandon the Great Mother's only son.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: We must speak to the Emperor - there might be another way to free the prince.

86.speaker: Lae'zel
86.text: Orpheus will die by my hand. So I have spoken, so it is recorded in slate.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: Come. Let this day be the Netherbrain's last!

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: The brain is near. Let it be your one and only focus.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Perhaps we might share a kiss before our final stand?

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: No. First, the Netherbrain. Once it is fallen, we'll speak of the future beyond.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: You are my today. And should fate will it, my tomorrow.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You must be disgusted with me, now that I look like a mind flayer.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: My instinct is to flay you where you stand.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: But I am more than my instinct.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: You made an incredible sacrifice - for me, for my people, for the Prince of the Comet.

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: I know who you are, and I know what you gave up. You are the source of my bruises, the source of my joy, and more still: you are mla'ghir - 'liberator'.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: I know who you are, and I know what you gave up. You aren't illithid: you are mla'ghir - 'liberator'.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: As long as the Netherbrain lives, so must you. Yes, I see a ghaik before me. But I also see something more: victory.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: I am iron, steel, and silver. I am my Mother's blade. Ch'mar, zal'a Gith!

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: I am iron, steel, and silver. I am Vlaakith's blade. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Are you ready to face the Netherbrain?

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: The Prince of the Comet is fallen - and so I blaze a path to victory in his name.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: Never again will my people suffer under illithid enslavement. Zai, zai, zai!
49.context: NodeContext: ZI, like eye! Battle cry of sorts, hyping herself up.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: I am. With the Prince of the Comet at our side, we will wreck the Netherbrain and its Grand Design.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: I am. Never again will my people suffer under illithid enslavement. Zai, zai, zai!
14.context: NodeContext: ZI, like eye! Battle cry of sorts, hyping herself up.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Our moment of triumph draws closer. Our enemies will paint us with bruises - and we will wear them with pride.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: My prince - may your mother forgive me. And may the githyanki people one day know the freedom they so richly deserve.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: You took my prince from me, from his people.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: You had a choice. And you took my prince from me, from his people.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: By every right, I should cut off your limbs one by one and leave you to your screams.
24.context: NodeContext: Coming down from feeling incensed.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: But I made my promise. We will slay the Netherbrain and end the illithid Grand Design.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: I will decide after that where my path should lead.

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: Tell me why I should not cut off your limbs one by one and leave you to your screams.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Because you need me to help end the Netherbrain. Don't pretend otherwise.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I dare you to try. You know you have no chance against me.

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: We will end the Grand Design. And then we will go our separate ways.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: O Gith, Great Emancipator, Mother of my people, reveal your light and guide me forward. Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht.

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: No more words. I gave you my trust - and you failed me.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: To think I once called you zhak vo'n'fynh duj...

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.context: NodeContext: HTA-lak KRITH ma-HAR! - Die, treacherous scum!

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: I will not forget what you did here today. Nor will the githyanki people.

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: We have unchained the true heir. First, he will lead us to victory against the Netherbrain -

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: - then, he will loose the githyanki from Vlaakith's undead talons.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: You have done it, Praise Vlaakith! Gith's faithless son is fallen!

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: The Netherbrain will soon follow - and I shall ascend to my queen.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: I shall slay the traitor prince once the brain has fallen, mark my words. Nothing will stop me.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: The Netherbrain believes it will rise victorious. But it could never predict the extent of our might and the heat of our fury.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: Such blazing wonder, to stand together and behold the sky swarming with red dragons - they may roar Vlaakith's name, but I can't deny their beauty.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: For this one moment, in this one battle, the lich queen and I share a common cause: the Netherbrain's defeat, and the Grand Design's failure.
